description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d1ve7","text":"Diagnosis and surveillance of emerging pathogens such as SARS-CoV-2 depend on nucleic acid isolation from clinical and environmental samples. Under normal circumstances, samples would be processed using commercial proprietary reagents in Biosafety 2 (BSL-2) or higher facilities. A pandemic at the scale of COVID-19 has caused a global shortage of proprietary reagents and BSL-2 laboratories to safely perform testing. Therefore, alternative solutions are urgently needed to address these challenges. We developed an open-source method called Magneticnanoparticle-Aided Viral RNA Isolation of Contagious Samples (MAVRICS) that is built upon reagents that are either readily available or can be synthesized in any molecular biology laboratory with basic equipment. Unlike conventional methods, MAVRICS works directly in samples inactivated in acid guanidinium thiocyanate-phenol-chloroform (e.g., TRIzol), thus allowing infectious samples to be handled safely without biocontainment facilities.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: SARS-CoV-2,MAVRICS,COVID-19,RNA extraction,Magnetic nanoparticle synthesis,Silica magnetic nanoparticles (SiMNP),

materials.name: Ethanol absolute ≥99.8% AnalaR NORMAPUR® ACS Reag. Ph. Eur. analytical reagent

Recommended dilution for swab samples mixed with TRIzol is 1 volume of fully resuspended SiMNP stock to 4 volumes of RNase-free water. The optimal ratio for other samples should be determined empirically; typical dilution ranges from 1:4 to 1:10.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beu40","text":"Settle the SiMNPs on a magnetic stand and remove the supernatant. Follow local safety guidelines when handling and disposing these reagents.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"562u1","text":"Add   of 90% ethanol and mix well,  spin for 2-3 seconds, settle the siMNPs on a magnetic stand and remove the supernatant.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":123,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9u2ku","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cgvtq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"400","guid":"1E11CCFAC67711EA92280A58A9FEAC2A","id":"87656","label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"29D4BFBFC67711EA92280A58A9FEAC2A","id":"79124","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"48qc5","text":"It is highly recommended to prepare fresh 90% ethanol before use. Make sure the 90% ethanol container is closed tightly to prevent evaporation. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7aifh","text":"Repeat Setp 4.6 three more times for a total of 4 ethanol washes  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9cdp5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":360,"guid":"F4367FA0C67F11EAB5358304AAAE8122","id":"79125","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rmdk","text":"After removing the supernatant from the last ethanol wash, dry the SiMNPs on a heat block at 50°C. Keep the lid open, no shaking. Do not elute before the SiMNPs are dried.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":173,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6lnfb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2fn87","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"e3eq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"0A0F906CC68011EA92280A58A9FEAC2A","id":"79126","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"41d5g","text":"Drying may take less than 20 min. Monitor the appearance of the SiMNPs during drying. The SiMNPs appear in a rusty brownish color when dried. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8e5rf","text":" To elute the RNA, add   nuclease-free water, and mix at  for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":57,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"40","duration":300,"guid":"8369EB6CC68111EA92280A58A9FEAC2A","id":"87657","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1300","guid":"8369E9ECC68111EA92280A58A9FEAC2A","id":"87658","label":"","unit":1268}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1300","duration":300,"guid":"8369EAA2C68111EA92280A58A9FEAC2A","id":"79127","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"unit":1268}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vua7","text":"Settle the SiMNPs on a magnetic stand and transfer the eluted RNA to a new RNase-free tube.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":91,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"phcd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3h9fm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"52rkb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"E0F9F5A0C68111EAB5358304AAAE8122","id":"79128","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3v4po","text":"Pipet slowly, avoid taking up SiMNPs.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87h3k","text":"Analyze RNA concentration and purity using a Qubit fluorometer or Nanodrop. {"blocks":[{"key":"a14f3","text":"Store RNA at -80℃ or use immediately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ijn2","text":"Reverse transcription (RT): use   of eluted RNA and follow the instructions for SuperScript™ IV Reverse Transcriptase adding the RNase H incubation step.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":80,"length":37},{"key":2,"offset":154,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"dbbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"19q67","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f4dq0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b02ar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"4","guid":"7DE26370BF5711EAAD75E904FFFF3CA1","id":"87659","label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C3609C50BF5711EAAD75E904FFFF3CA1","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/document-connect/document-connect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.thermofisher.com%2FTFS-Assets%2FLSG%2Fmanuals%2FSSIV_Reverse_Transcriptase_UG.pdf\u0026title=VXNlciBHdWlkZTogU3VwZXJTY3JpcHQgSVYgUmV2ZXJzZSBUcmFuc2NyaXB0YXNl"}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"CB364760C68A11EA89D29BF25C1FA845","id":"79130","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c77le","text":"User should optimize the input RNA amount.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7oppm","text":"Real-time PCR: For each   qPCR reaction mix    cDNA,    SARS-CoV-2 (2019-nCoV) CDC qPCR Probe Assay,   TaqMan Fast Advanced Master Mix, and   nuclease-free water. Run qPCR on a Biorad CFX384 Touch Real-Time PCR Detection System (or similar instrument) using the following program: 50°C for 2 min, 95°C for 2 min followed by 45 cycles of 95°C for 5 sec and 59°C for 30 sec.
